channel.title: [DELTA]How do I create random server messages that come up at random times?
channel.description:
To make my question simple this is what i want to do...have a number of messages such as
"vote today" and "check out are site for help",
and each message will come up at random times in the game, but it is a message to all players online....how do I do this? i never done something like this before, so I would like to know how...thanks for your help

item.title: [DELTA]How do I create random server messages that come up at random times?

item.description:

All I had to do is create a even manger and recode the code that fits me

item.title: [DELTA]How do I create random server messages that come up at random times?
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:10, topic:518822”][quote author=Sup22211 link=topic=637090.msg4296183#msg4296183 date=1368262874]
Thats exactly what you need,:
int timer = 0;

under process method;

if(timer >= 0){ timer++; } if(timer >= 500){ sendMessage("Your message"); timer = 0; }
[/quote]

:fp:[/quote]
What is that mean lol…

Read full topic
item.source: [DELTA]How do I create random server messages that come up at random times?

item.title: [DELTA]How do I create random server messages that come up at random times?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

How does Delta keep track of uptime? (or better said, how does Delta’s core loop look like?)
If it’s in ticks you can easily add a counter that ticks down to 0.
When it’s at zero it would:

  1. pick a message in an array of messages (java.util.Random.nextInt(Array.length)) and send it to all players.
  2. set the counter to a MINIMUM_LENGTH + random number.

Read full topic
